description:
A **full-text search** on a website is the best way to make its
**contents** easily accessible to **users** because it returns better
results and is in fact used in *online search engines* or *social
networks*.

The implementation of full-text search can be complex and many adopt the
strategy of using **dedicated search engines** in addition to the
**database**, but in most cases this strategy turns out to be a big
problem of **architecture** and **performance**.

In this talk we'll see a **pythonic** way to implement full-text search
on a website using only Django and PostgreSQL, taking advantage of all
the **innovations** introduced in latest years, and we'll analyze the
**problems** of using additional search engines with examples deriving
from my experience on *djangoproject.com*.

Through this talk you can learn how to add a full-text search on your
**website**, if it's based on **Django** and **PostgreSQL**, or you can
learn how to update the search function of your website if you use other
search engines.
title: A pythonic full-text search
